CatDescriptText: Miss Mary Alice O'Brien, junior of Sacred Heart High School, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 11, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that students are getting adequate vocational counseling in the schools these days? Do you have any suggestions for increasing or improving it?" answer reads: "No, I think that there should be more discussion of the various jobs and professions.  And this should begin during the freshman year and not during the senior or junior years as is the case today."
TitMainTitle: Two women, including Mary Alice O'Brien, wearing light colored button down short sleeved dress with crinoline skirt and belt, holding Kaufmann's paper bag and basket handbag, standing in front of store window with peg board walls, and dark stone block wall
